page.title: 04HISTORY OF GOLDHANGER CHURCH
page.content: St.Peters Church was built in 11th century.St.Peters is made from pudding stone and also flint.Round the back of the church is some Roman remains which were there before they built the actual church.The chancel and nave dwarfed by the massive tower and buttresses were added 300 years later. The south aisle and door of the church were built or rebuilt rather late in the 14th century and the southchapel was made later.In 1836 the church passed into the Leigh family.They repaired the neglected and dilapidated church.The south aisle and chancel arch were rebulit and window tracery was brought out and new stained glass was put in.
